description:
The system module allows developers to access system properties. Part of these system properties are environment variables, local variable to the process running Zorba, and properties defined by Zorba.

To avoid conflicts between environment variables and properties defined by Zorba, all environment variables are prefixed with env..

For instance, the following query: 

 import module namespace system = "http://www.zorba-xquery.com/modules/system";
 for $prop in system:properties()
 return concat($prop, ": ", system:property($prop), "
 ")

Will output: 

 env.TERM_PROGRAM: Apple_Terminal
 ...
In this example, it is important to notice that the environnement variable PATH with the key env.PATH.

functions.name: all-properties
functions.description:
This function retrieves all names and values from the current system properties. This list includes environment variables, local variable to the process running Zorba, and properties defined by Zorba.

To avoid conflicts between environment variables and properties defined by Zorba, all environment variables are prefixed with env..
functions.summary: This function retrieves all names and values from the current system properties.

returns.description: List of all system properties as a JSONiq Object sequence.

functions.name: properties
functions.description:
This function retrieves the names of the current system properties. This list includes environment variables, local variable to the process running Zorba, and properties defined by Zorba.

To avoid conflicts between environment variables and properties defined by Zorba, all environment variables are prefixed with env..
functions.summary: This function retrieves the names of the current system properties.

functions.name: property
functions.description: Gets the system property indicated by the specified key.
functions.summary: Gets the system property indicated by the specified key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the system property.

returns.description: The string value of the system property, or an empty sequence if there is no property with that key.

variables.name: system:ZORBA-VERSION-PATCH
variables.description: Zorba patch version (zorba.version.patch).

variables.name: system:ZORBA-VERSION-MINOR
variables.description: Zorba minor version (zorba.version.minor).

variables.name: system:ZORBA-VERSION-MAJOR
variables.description: Zorba major version (zorba.version.major).

variables.name: system:ZORBA-VERSION
variables.description: Zorba version in the format Major.Minor.Patch (zorba.version).

variables.name: system:ZORBA-MODULE-PATH
variables.description:
The Zorba module path, that is the paths in which Zorba looks
 for modules (zorba.module.path).

variables.name: system:USER-NAME
variables.description:
The username, with which this process was started (user.name).
 On Unix, this variable is only available if the USER environment
 variable is set (e.g. it might not be available in a cronjob).

variables.name: system:LINUX-DISTRIBUTOR-VERSION
variables.description: The version of the Linux distribution, Zorba is running on (linux.distributor.version). Works on UNIX based operating systems only.

variables.name: system:LINUX-DISTRIBUTOR
variables.description: The Linux distribution, Zorba is running on (linux.distributor). Works on UNIX based operating systems only.

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-MANUFACTURER
variables.description: Gets the hardware manufacturer (hardware.manufacturer).

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-VIRTUAL-MEMORY
variables.description: Virtual memory available (hardware.virtual.memory).

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-PHSICAL-MEMORY
variables.description: Physical memory available (hardware.physical.memory).

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-LOGICAL-PER-PHYSICAL-CPU
variables.description:
number of logical per physical processors in the system (hardware.logical.per.physical.cpu).
 This information is not available under Mac OS X.

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-PHYSICAL-CPU
variables.description: Number of physical processors in the system (hardware.physical.cpu).

variables.name: system:HARDWARE-LOGICAL-CPU
variables.description:
Number of logical processors in the system (hardware.logical.cpu).
 This information is not available under Mac OS X.

variables.name: system:OS-IS64
variables.description: True if system architecture is 64bits (os.is64).

variables.name: system:OS-ARCH
variables.description:
The name of the processor architecture (os.arch).
 For example x86 or x86_64.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION
variables.description: The version of the Operating System.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION-VERSION
variables.description: The version of this UNIX installation or an empty string if the process does not run on a UNIX/Linux installation (os.version.version). Works on UNIX based operating systems only.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION-RELEASE
variables.description: The release of this UNIX installation or an empty string if the process does not run on a UNIX/Linux installation (os.version.release). Works on UNIX based operating systems only.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION-BUILD
variables.description: The build number of the Windows installation or an empty string if the process does not run on a Windows installation (os.version.build). Works on Windows only.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION-MINOR
variables.description: The minor version number of the Windows installation or an empty string if the process does not run on a Windows installation (os.version.minor). Works on Windows only.

variables.name: system:OS-VERSION-MAJOR
variables.description: The major version number of the Windows installation or an empty string if the process does not run on a Windows installation (os.version.major). Works on Windows only.

variables.name: system:OS-NODE-NAME
variables.description: The name of the computer the process is running on (os.node.name).

variables.name: system:OS-NAME
variables.description: The name of the operating system (os.name).
